CDC-2025-0024-5096 2025-06-19 Deborah Stewart
COVID Vaccine Access and Availability: Support for Removal of COVID Vaccines Scientific Standards and Evidence for Vaccine Policy: Oppose Current Standards / Claim Insufficient Testing Public Trust and Transparency: Oppose Current Process Due to Perceived Lack of Trust
 None ACIP – Want to Regain the Public’s Trust? I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. In 1976, the swine flu vaccine was immediately pulled after approximately 25 people died following vaccination. As of May 30, 2025, the... 1 1:500 I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. The comment expresses support for the removal of COVID vaccines, citing adverse event data and insisting on higher scientific standards for vaccine testing. It also highlights a perceived lack of public trust in ACIP, indicating a need for changes to regain that trust.
CDC-2025-0024-9416 2025-06-23 A C
Committee Composition and Expertise (ACIP Appointments): Support for Independent Expert Committee Access and Equity in Vaccines: Support for Universal Vaccine Access COVID Vaccine Access and Availability: Oppose Removal of COVID Vaccines Public Trust and Transparency: Support for Increased Transparency/Disclosure Scientific Standards and Evidence for Vaccine Policy: Support for Science-Based/Strict Evidence Standards
 None To the CDC ACIP committee: I have no conflicts of interest to disclose. I am writing to express my grave concerns about the recent termination of all 17 existing CDC ACIP committee members, announced on June 9 by Robert F. Kennedy, Jr. Independent expert scientific and medical input from the ACIP c... 1 1:500 The recent restrictions on COVID vaccinations are a serious concern. All of us must have regular access to updated COVID vaccines, which must be made available widely and must be covered by health insurance. These theme:position combinations were selected because the commenter expresses clear support for maintaining independent expertise on the ACIP, emphasizes the need for universal access to vaccines, opposes restrictions on COVID vaccinations, and advocates for a science-based and transparent vaccine policy process.
CDC-2025-0024-8369 2025-06-21 Anonymous Anonymous
Public Trust and Transparency: Support for Increased Transparency/Disclosure Committee Composition and Expertise (ACIP Appointments): Support for Independent Expert Committee Public Trust and Transparency: Oppose Current Process Due to Perceived Lack of Trust ⚠️
 None I would like the new ACIP committee to ensure that they discuss the following items and/or a timeline of written disclosure for the following items: 1. What is the timeline for disclosure of a complete accounting of all financial conflicts of interest, both past and present, for each newly appointe... 1 1:500 Please also disclose which independent auditing agency that will be hired to confirm that these are their only financial conflicts of interest. The commenter expresses support for increased transparency and disclosure regarding financial conflicts of interest among ACIP members, as well as a desire for independent expertise on the committee. Additionally, there are concerns about the current process's lack of trust, indicating a need for public assurance and clarity in committee operations.
CDC-2025-0024-3501 2025-06-18 Jamie Martisius
COVID Vaccine Access and Availability: Support for Removal of COVID Vaccines Scientific Standards and Evidence for Vaccine Policy: Oppose Current Standards / Claim Insufficient Testing Public Trust and Transparency: Oppose Current Process Due to Perceived Lack of Trust
 None ACIP – Want to Regain the Public’s Trust? I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. In 1976, the swine flu vaccine was immediately pulled after approximately 25 people died following vaccination. As of May 30, 2025, the... 1 1:500 If ACIP is ever to regain the trust of the American people, it must start with removing COVID shot recommendations and establishing sound and rigorous research of all vaccines prior to marketing. The selected theme:position combinations reflect the commenter's clear call for removing COVID vaccines from the market, citing safety concerns and the need for rigorous scientific standards. Additionally, the commenter emphasizes the lack of public trust in ACIP's current actions, indicating dissatisfaction with the process.
CDC-2025-0024-3017 2025-06-18 Tim Sr. Rose

 None ACIP – Want to Regain the Public’s Trust? I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. In 1976, the swine flu vaccine was immediately pulled after approximately 25 people died following vaccination. As of May 30, 2025, the... 1 1:500 I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. The comment clearly expresses support for the removal of COVID vaccines and criticizes the current standards of testing for vaccines. It also emphasizes the need for the ACIP to regain public trust, indicating dissatisfaction with the current processes and recommendations.
CDC-2025-0024-11273 2025-06-24 Anonymous Citizen
COVID Vaccine Access and Availability: Oppose Removal of COVID Vaccines Access and Equity in Vaccines: Support for Universal Vaccine Access Role of Vaccines in Public Health: Support for Vaccines as Essential Public Health Tool
 None It is unconscionable to dishonor the millions of people who died due to COVID by denying the public access to lifesaving vaccines. This will disproportionately impact our most vulnerable communities and directly result in unnecessary suffering and death. It will cause heartbreak for families who los... 1 1:500 It is unconscionable to dishonor the millions of people who died due to COVID by denying the public access to lifesaving vaccines. The comment emphasizes the importance of maintaining access to COVID vaccines to prevent unnecessary suffering and death, reflecting support for universal access and the role of vaccines in safeguarding public health. It strongly opposes the removal of these vaccines, articulating a moral imperative to preserve vaccine availability for vulnerable communities.
CDC-2025-0024-1836 2025-06-18 Judith Wagner
COVID Vaccine Access and Availability: Support for Removal of COVID Vaccines Scientific Standards and Evidence for Vaccine Policy: Oppose Current Standards / Claim Insufficient Testing Public Trust and Transparency: Support for Increased Transparency/Disclosure
 None ACIP – Want to Regain the Public’s Trust? I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. In 1976, the swine flu vaccine was immediately pulled after approximately 25 people died following vaccination. As of May 30, 2025, the... 1 1:500 I urge ACIP members to take a firm stance for public health and remove all currently licensed COVID shots from the market. The commenter advocates for the removal of all COVID vaccines, citing safety concerns and the need for rigorous testing standards. Additionally, they emphasize the importance of regaining public trust through transparent and sound research practices, which aligns with the selected theme:position combinations regarding vaccine access, scientific standards, and the need for increased transparency.
CDC-2025-0024-9428 2025-06-23 Anonymous Anonymous
COVID Vaccine Access and Availability: Oppose Removal of COVID Vaccines Committee Composition and Expertise (ACIP Appointments): Support for Independent Expert Committee Scientific Standards and Evidence for Vaccine Policy: Support for Science-Based/Strict Evidence Standards Access and Equity in Vaccines: Support for Universal Vaccine Access Role of Vaccines in Public Health: Support for Vaccines as Essential Public Health Tool
 None Docket: CDC-2025-0024 June 15, 2025 Public Comment for the June 25-27, 2025 CDC ACIP Committee Meeting To the CDC ACIP committee: I have no conflicts of interest to disclose. I am writing to express my grave concerns about the recent termination of all 17 existing CDC ACIP committee members, ann... 1 1:500 The recent restrictions on COVID vaccinations are a serious concern. All of us must have regular access to updated COVID vaccines, which must be made available widely and must be covered by health insurance. The selected theme:position combinations reflect the commenter's opposition to the removal of COVID vaccines, support for maintaining a committee of independent experts, advocacy for science-based vaccine policies, insistence on universal access to vaccines, and recognition of vaccines as essential public health tools. The comment emphasizes the importance of access and effective vaccination to prevent serious diseases, aligning with these positions.
CDC-2025-0024-9289 2025-06-23 Anonymous Anonymous

Kennedy, Jr. These former members have an important role as independent expert... 1 1:500 Creating barriers to covid vaccine access for either children or adults is harmful to the public’s health and contributes to the spread of disease. The commenter strongly opposes the removal of COVID vaccines and emphasizes the essential role of independent scientific experts in the ACIP committee. They express concerns about transparency and public trust regarding decision-making processes, while also advocating for broad vaccine access as crucial to preventing serious health consequences from infectious diseases.
